articles.author: Gleb Garanich, Valentyn Ogirenko
articles.description: At least nine people were injured, including an 11-year-old girl, and several apartments were on fire after a Russian drone attack on Kyiv, Ukrainian officials said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Nine injured in Russian drone attack on Kyiv, Ukraine's officials say

articles.author: Nathan Layne, Joseph Tanfani, Ned Parker
articles.description: With the U.S. election days just away, officials in the most competitive battleground states are bracing for misinformation, conspiracy theories, threats and possible violence.
articles.title: In US swing states, officials brace for conspiracy theories and violence

articles.author: Eva Manez, David Latona
articles.description: At least 51 people have been killed in flash floods sweeping the eastern Spanish region of Valencia following torrential rains on Tuesday that left roads and towns under water, local authorities said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Spain flash floods kill at least 51 people in Valencia region

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A series of Israeli military strikes across the Gaza Strip killed at least 20 people on Wednesday, medics said.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill 20 Palestinians in Gaza, medics say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's office said on Wednesday he had "not ever" called the chief executive of airline Qantas seeking flight upgrades, denying an allegation aired in a book that has brewed into a political storm over integrity.
articles.title: Australia PM Albanese denies asking Qantas chief for flight upgrades

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korean Foreign Minister Choe Son Hui will hold strategic consultations in Moscow with her Russian counterpart Sergei Lavrov, Russia's Foreign Ministry announced on Wednesday.
articles.title: North Korean and Russian foreign ministers to hold Moscow talks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Israeli military issued a new evacuation warning on Wednesday for residents of a large area of the eastern Lebanese city of Baalbek and its 3,000-year-old Roman ruins.
articles.title: Israel issues evacuation warning for Lebanon's Baalbek, including Roman ruins area

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Canada alleged on Tuesday that Amit Shah, India's interior minister and the chief aide of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, was behind plots to target Sikh separatists on Canadian soil.
articles.title: Canada names chief aide of India's Modi in campaign against Sikh separatists

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Republican U.S. presidential candidate Donald Trump said on Tuesday the European Union would have to "pay a big price" for not buying enough American exports if he won the Nov. 5 election.
articles.title: Europe will pay a 'big price,' Trump warns on tariffs

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Kremlin complained on Wednesday about what it called "unacceptable" treatment of a team of Russian journalists who travelled to the United States to cover next week's presidential election.
articles.title: Kremlin complains at treatment of Russian press covering US election
